newsitem.title: CHINA: Cockerill Sambre in China steel pact.
newsitem.headline: Cockerill Sambre in China steel pact.

text.p: An affiliate of Belgian steelmaker Cockerill Sambre has signed a memorandum of understanding to install galvanised steel production lines worth 2-3 billion Belgian francs ($64-96 million) for a Chinese steelmaker, Belgian officials said on Wednesday.

CMI Cockerill Mechanical Industries SA signed the accord with state-owned Wuhan Iron and Steel Corp in Wuhan city in the central province of Hubei, Belgian Vice-Premier Philippe Maystadt told a news conference in Beijing.
The pact still needs the approval of China's State Planning Commission, he said.
"This contract will considerably strengthen the group's presence in China," Maystadt said.
Maystadt was part of a 210-member Belgian economic delegation which arrived in China on Monday for a 12-day visit.
